subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Iranian Revolution: Theocracy Returns
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Iranian Revolution: Theocracy Returns usable.

hook.text: In 1979, a 76-year-old cleric overthrew a king. Iran became the first modern Islamic theocracy. No one expected it.

buildup.text: Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi modernized Iran but suppressed dissent. Ayatollah Khomeini led the revolution from exile.

discovery.text: Khomeini created 'velayat-e faqih' â€” rule by Islamic jurists. Religion didn't just influence law; it became the law.

twist.text: The revolution inspired Islamists worldwide but horrified secular Muslims. For some, liberation; for others, a prison.

climax.text: Iran proved that Islam could be a revolutionary force in the modern world. The debate over its legacy continues.

punchline.text: A cleric overthrew a king. Iran showed Islam could topple empires.

quiz.question: What did the Iranian Revolution establish?
options: The world's first modern Islamic theocracy
